meanings.definition: Obtain by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He was caught fenagling the answers during the test.
meanings.sent2: She always fenagles her way out of doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was fenagling through the trash for a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was fenagling money from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox was fenagling its prey with clever tactics.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or scheme in a sly or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The magician was fenagling the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: She was fenagling her coworkers to get ahead in the company.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat was fenagling its way into the house through an open window.
meanings.sent4: The spy was fenagling classified information from the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The crafty thief was fenagling his escape from the museum.
